thread.section_title: National election, campaign, political news | The Denver Post
thread.title: press conference reaction: Bennet throws shade, Gardner focuses on agriculture and more
thread.title_full: Trump press conference reaction: Bennet throws shade, Gardner focuses on agriculture and more – The Denver Post

author: The Denver Post
title: press conference reaction: Bennet throws shade, Gardner focuses on agriculture and more
text:
After a combative news conference where aired his grievances against the news media, the intelligence community and his detractors during a stream-of-consciousness news conference that alternated between claims that he had “inherited a mess” and the assertion that his fledgling administration “is running like a fine-tuned machine.”
U.S. Sen. Michael Bennet, Colorado’s senior senator, was quick to post a gif on Twitter showing his view of Trump’s “fine-tuned machine.”
. @POTUS : "This administration is running like a fine-tuned machine." pic.twitter.com/m0rO7oQMOv
— Michael F. Bennet (@SenBennetCO) February 16, 2017
The rest of Colorado’s delegation didn’t immediately post any reaction to the news conference.
Instead, U.S. Sen. Cory Gardner, Colorado’s Republican senator, notified constituents he was set to talk about the importance of Colorado’s agriculture on the senate floor.
Heading to the Senate floor to discuss the importance of #Agriculture to Colorado. Watch live here: https://t.co/LoKspv71t1
— Cory Gardner (@SenCoryGardner) February 16, 2017
While U.S. Rep. Diana DeGette, D-Denver, challenged House Speaker Paul Ryan to explain the House GOP’s position on cutting funding for Planned Parenthood and TitleX.
Really, @SpeakerRyan ? So why is @HouseGOP so eager to attack women’s health and ditch #TitleX funds? Can you explain? We’ll wait. pic.twitter.com/dfymBPyk9k
— Rep. Diana DeGette (@RepDianaDeGette) February 16, 2017
U.S. Rep. Ed Perlmutter, D-Arvada, urged Ryan to start an independent investigation into Russia’s role in the 2016 presidential election.
. @SpeakerRyan , it’s time to #FollowTheFacts . You must allow an independent commission on Russia’s influence on our election.
— Rep. Ed Perlmutter (@RepPerlmutter) February 16, 2017
And U.S. Rep. Jared Polis, D-Boulder, promoted his new Cannabis Caucus .
For the first time, it’s a majority of Americans that will have access to medical or recreational marijuana. https://t.co/z2wVPnRulJ
— Rep. Jared Polis (@RepJaredPolis) February 16, 2017
On Wednesday, U.S. Rep. Scott Tipton, R-Cortez, posted a message about joining with Gardner and Polis to support a bill to cut federal alcohol taxes for kombucha and update regulations for the issue.
Too often, federal regulations get in the way of #SmallBiz innovation. Glad to join @RepJaredPolis @SenCoryGardner on this solution. https://t.co/xmqH4eBc1r
— Rep. Scott Tipton (@RepTipton) February 15, 2017
U.S. Rep. Doug Lamborn, R-Colorado Springs, posted a photo of receiving the True Blue Award from the Family Research Council.
Honored to receive the True Blue Award from @FRCdc . For more information about my pro-family policies, visit https://t.co/pbEtwifkUU pic.twitter.com/BCGWHimLdR
— Rep. Doug Lamborn (@RepDLamborn) February 16, 2017
Neither U.S. Rep. Mike Coffman (R-Aurora) nor U.S. Rep. Ken Buck (R-Windsor) have posted anything since Feb. 14 when Coffman posted about joining the Denver CBS affiliate’s broadcast and Buck urged constituents to join him a telephone town hall.
Happy to have joined @CBSDenver this evening. Be sure to watch tonight at 10pm. pic.twitter.com/mSzMydWzJj
— Rep. Mike Coffman (@RepMikeCoffman) February 15, 2017
Join me on a telephone town hall next week, February 23rd, at 7:00 PM: https://t.co/gub1RPVWi5
— Congressman Ken Buck (@RepKenBuck) February 14, 2017
